body.p: Each of the following neurons (cells) are part of the nervous system. Based on the description of its location and function, classify each as belonging to either the Central Nervous System division (CNS) or the Peripheral Nervous System division (PNS):
Neuron is associated with thermoreceptor in skin, as in cake baking example.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The CNS includes the brain and spinal cord; this is a sensory neuron that would be part of a spinal nerve.
Correct. This sensory neuron is part of a spinal nerve outside the brain and spinal cord, carrying impulse to the central nervous system.

part.hint: Consider whether the neuron would be more likely to be found in the brain/spinal cord (CNS) or the limbs/organs (PNS).

body.p: Neuron is associated with nasal chemoreceptors, detecting the smell of the baking cake.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The CNS includes the brain and spinal cord; this is a sensory neuron that would be part of a cranial nerve.
Correct. This sensory neuron is part of a cranial nerve outside the brain and spinal cord, carrying impulse to the central nervous system.

part.hint: Consider whether the neuron would be more likely to be found in the brain/spinal cord (CNS) or the limbs/organs (PNS).

body.p: Neuron is associated with internal thermoreceptors near hypothalamus, as in temperature example.

response.feedback: Correct. Even though it is a sensory neuron, it is located completely within the brain, monitoring the temperature of blood brought there by arteries.
Incorrect. This is tricky because even though it is associated with a thermoreceptor, it is located completely within the brain, so it is not part of the peripheral nervous system.

part.hint: Consider whether the neuron would be more likely to be found in the brain/spinal cord (CNS) or the limbs/organs (PNS).
